camel.sink.path.destinationType.name: camel.sink.path.destinationType
camel.sink.path.destinationType.description: The kind of destination to use One of: [queue] [topic]

camel.sink.path.destinationName.name: camel.sink.path.destinationName
camel.sink.path.destinationName.description: DestinationName is a JMS queue or topic name. By default, the destinationName is interpreted as a queue name.

camel.sink.endpoint.acknowledgementMode.name: camel.sink.endpoint.acknowledgementMode
camel.sink.endpoint.acknowledgementMode.description: The JMS acknowledgement name, which is one of: SESSION_TRANSACTED, CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE, AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE, DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE One of: [SESSION_TRANSACTED] [CLIENT_ACKNOWLEDGE] [AUTO_ACKNOWLEDGE] [DUPS_OK_ACKNOWLEDGE]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.namedReplyTo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.namedReplyTo
camel.sink.endpoint.namedReplyTo.description: Sets the reply to destination name used for InOut producer endpoints. The type of the reply to destination can be determined by the starting prefix (topic: or queue:) in its name.

camel.sink.endpoint.persistent.name: camel.sink.endpoint.persistent
camel.sink.endpoint.persistent.description: Flag used to enable/disable message persistence.

camel.sink.endpoint.producerCount.name: camel.sink.endpoint.producerCount
camel.sink.endpoint.producerCount.description: Sets the number of producers used for this endpoint.

camel.sink.endpoint.ttl.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ttl
camel.sink.endpoint.ttl.description: Flag used to adjust the Time To Live value of produced messages.

camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullBody.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullBody
camel.sink.endpoint.allowNullBody.description: Whether to allow sending messages with no body. If this option is false and the message body is null, then an JMSException is thrown.

camel.sink.endpoint.prefillPool.name: camel.sink.endpoint.prefillPool
camel.sink.endpoint.prefillPool.description: Whether to prefill the producer connection pool on startup, or create connections lazy when needed.

camel.sink.endpoint.responseTimeOut.name: camel.sink.endpoint.responseTimeOut
camel.sink.endpoint.responseTimeOut.description: Sets the amount of time we should wait before timing out a InOut response.

camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStartListener.name: camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStartListener
camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStartListener.description: Whether to startup the consumer message listener asynchronously, when starting a route. For example if a JmsConsumer cannot get a connection to a remote JMS broker, then it may block while retrying and/or failover. This will cause Camel to block while starting routes. By setting this option to true, you will let routes startup, while the JmsConsumer connects to the JMS broker using a dedicated thread in asynchronous mode. If this option is used, then beware that if the connection could not be established, then an exception is logged at WARN level, and the consumer will not be able to receive messages; You can then restart the route to retry.

camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStopListener.name: camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStopListener
camel.sink.endpoint.asyncStopListener.description: Whether to stop the consumer message listener asynchronously, when stopping a route.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionCount.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionCount
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionCount.description: The maximum number of connections available to this endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionFactory.description: Initializes the connectionFactory for the endpoint, which takes precedence over the component's connectionFactory, if any

camel.sink.endpoint.connectionResource.name: camel.sink.endpoint.connectionResource
camel.sink.endpoint.connectionResource.description: Initializes the connectionResource for the endpoint, which takes precedence over the component's connectionResource, if any

camel.sink.endpoint.exceptionListener.name: camel.sink.endpoint.exceptionListener
camel.sink.endpoint.exceptionListener.description: Specifies the JMS Exception Listener that is to be notified of any underlying JMS exceptions.

camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.headerFilterStrategy.description: To use a custom HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.sink.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProper.name: camel.sink.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProperties
camel.sink.endpoint.includeAllJMSXProper.description: Whether to include all JMSXxxx properties when mapping from JMS to Camel Message. Setting this to true will include properties such as JMSXAppID, and JMSXUserID etc. Note: If you are using a custom headerFilterStrategy then this option does not apply.

camel.sink.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrategy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.jmsKeyFormatStrategy.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides two implementations out of the box: default and passthrough. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). The passthrough strategy leaves the key as is. Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the # notation.

camel.sink.endpoint.mapJmsMessage.name: camel.sink.endpoint.mapJmsMessage
camel.sink.endpoint.mapJmsMessage.description: Specifies whether Camel should auto map the received JMS message to a suited payload type, such as javax.jms.TextMessage to a String etc. See section about how mapping works below for more details.

camel.sink.endpoint.messageCreatedStrate.name: camel.sink.endpoint.messageCreatedStrategy
camel.sink.endpoint.messageCreatedStrate.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

camel.sink.endpoint.sharedJMSSession.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sharedJMSSession
camel.sink.endpoint.sharedJMSSession.description: Specifies whether to share JMS session with other SJMS endpoints. Turn this off if your route is accessing to multiple JMS providers. If you need transaction against multiple JMS providers, use jms component to leverage XA transaction.

camel.component.sjms.connectionCount.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionCount
camel.component.sjms.connectionCount.description: The maximum number of connections available to endpoints started under this component

camel.component.sjms.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.sjms.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.sjms.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.sjms.basicPropertyBindin.name: camel.component.sjms.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.sjms.basicPropertyBindin.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.sjms.connectionClientId.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionClientId
camel.component.sjms.connectionClientId.description: The client ID to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms.connectionFactory.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionFactory
camel.component.sjms.connectionFactory.description: A ConnectionFactory is required to enable the SjmsComponent. It can be set directly or set set as part of a ConnectionResource.

camel.component.sjms.connectionMaxWait.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionMaxWait
camel.component.sjms.connectionMaxWait.description: The max wait time in millis to block and wait on free connection when the pool is exhausted when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms.connectionResource.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionResource
camel.component.sjms.connectionResource.description: A ConnectionResource is an interface that allows for customization and container control of the ConnectionFactory. See Plugable Connection Resource Management for further details.

camel.component.sjms.connectionTestOnBor.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionTestOnBorrow
camel.component.sjms.connectionTestOnBor.description: When using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource then should each javax.jms.Connection be tested (calling start) before returned from the pool.

camel.component.sjms.jmsKeyFormatStrateg.name: camel.component.sjms.jmsKeyFormatStrategy
camel.component.sjms.jmsKeyFormatStrateg.description: Pluggable strategy for encoding and decoding JMS keys so they can be compliant with the JMS specification. Camel provides one implementation out of the box: default. The default strategy will safely marshal dots and hyphens (. and -). Can be used for JMS brokers which do not care whether JMS header keys contain illegal characters. You can provide your own implementation of the org.apache.camel.component.jms.JmsKeyFormatStrategy and refer to it using the # notation.

camel.component.sjms.messageCreatedStrat.name: camel.component.sjms.messageCreatedStrategy
camel.component.sjms.messageCreatedStrat.description: To use the given MessageCreatedStrategy which are invoked when Camel creates new instances of javax.jms.Message objects when Camel is sending a JMS message.

camel.component.sjms.headerFilterStrateg.name: camel.component.sjms.headerFilterStrategy
camel.component.sjms.headerFilterStrateg.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message.

camel.component.sjms.connectionPassword.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionPassword
camel.component.sjms.connectionPassword.description: The password to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms.connectionUsername.name: camel.component.sjms.connectionUsername
camel.component.sjms.connectionUsername.description: The username to use when creating javax.jms.Connection when using the default org.apache.camel.component.sjms.jms.ConnectionFactoryResource.

camel.component.sjms.transactionCommitSt.name: camel.component.sjms.transactionCommitStrategy
camel.component.sjms.transactionCommitSt.description: To configure which kind of commit strategy to use. Camel provides two implementations out of the box, default and batch.
